text:
for a good start 
<http://www.lovethispic.com/uploaded_images/78229-Its-Friday-Lets-Rock.jpg>
<@U084A8RT8|juleschz> has joined the channel

How would you guys achieve the following?
I would like to have a view at the bottom and a recycler filling the top. When scrolling the recycler upwards the view1 should translate or shrink towards the bottom as well.  As soon as the recycler is the only view filling the screen it should behave like a standard fullsize recycler.
When flinging down it should stop at item1. View1 should only appear on a second fling or if the user scrolls continuously through the recycler's item1 to the view.
<@U053Q5G4E|valle> uploaded a file: <https://androidchat.slack.com/files/valle/F084G9K5L/anim.png|anim.png>

I had 3 different approaches, but neither did work. :disappointed:
1. view1 as a footer item of the recycler; 
2. With the coordinator layout
3. with a scrolling view and the nested recycler
/forgot recycler has onScroll, use it, implement it in the fragment/activity. if item 1 is visible, move View1 down or up
and work on translte the View1 beeing in onScrollLIstener in RecylerView
+1 for <@U0548MM6B>
<@U0548MM6B> I tried that. But onScrollChanged only delivered zeros for int i, int t, ...
int i, int t?

<@U053Q5G4E>: you can accumulate total scroll value from listener
cause it gives only values (x,y) of current movement
<@U0548MM6B> this was regarding the onScrollChanged event. It offers i, t, oldi and oldt : void onScrollChanged(int l, int t, int oldl, int oldt)
oh ok, so I need to add a ScrollListener?
<https://developer.android.com/reference/android/support/v7/widget/RecyclerView.OnScrollListener.html>
yes
i would do
Ok, thanks! I'll give it a try :simple_smile:
Works like a charm! Thanks again.
:simple_smile:
pretty sure you can use coordinator layout to do that since its exactly what it does with the toolbar/actionbar
Yeah, that's what I thought as well. But I doesn't seem to fire "onDependentViewChanged" Events in my Behavior.class, when scrolling the recycler
hmm I’ll have to give it a try sometime then and check it out
unfortunately ive been banned from opening android studio for a few days as my boss wants me doing other shenanigans =(
its been like a week since ive touched AS..
^pun??
that’s long time without a piece of AS
:smile:
android developer banned from opening Android Studio? Strange
yeah im working on libraries which are outside of AS
I would love to see Google's behavior class for the RecyclerView which hides behind this xml attribute:  ```app:layout_behavior="@string/appbar_scrolling_view_behavior"```
but took a break from that currently and enjoying STF beating me up trying to get this testing stuff in place
<@U053Q5G4E>: interesting I just tried looking for it and could not find the source either
<http://developer.android.com/reference/android/support/design/widget/CoordinatorLayout.Behavior.html?utm_campaign=io15&utm_source=dac&utm_medium=blog>
that is the best I can find which at least tells you all the behaviors available
<@U053Q5G4E>: found it
inside AS, scroll down in your project view and expand the design library jar
you can see all the behavior classes in there
the scrolling behavior is inside the appbarlayout
so that would explain why you did not get the callback you needed
well maybe anyways.. not clear yet

Hi guys,
I’m building an app for on-site tablets (the device is fixed, and belongs to the staff, but the user will use it), and i’m wondering what’s the best way to have my app always on screen, and avoid the user to open other apps (even settings windows) that mine.
Code my own launcher ? Maybe are there some “system apps” which does the trick ?
<@U084A8RT8>:  is it 5.0+ device?
if so, you’re best off just pinning the screen
otherwise, you need a bunch of hacks
kiosk mode
<http://www.andreas-schrade.de/2015/02/16/android-tutorial-how-to-create-a-kiosk-mode-in-android/>
that post missed something
the pulldown notification/settings
idk, #1 link on google
come on <@U0548MM6B> you know how lazy I am
:smile:
Custom launcher is the best approach here I think
key kiosk mode looks interesting
but like bluecup said, the notification will still be displayed on swipe
you’ll need to dynamically add a view on top of all your views which will override onTouch
or smthn like that
been a long time since I did it
or just cover notification area with something physical
that too can be done
or just cut users’ fingers.
I’d do that.
looks to be a good option
ok, will try the solution+onTouch preventing
yeah just if anyone touches the tablet, shock them and say no touchign
<@U051G3BC3>: the user still be able to pull down notifications with other parts of his body
edge case
It remains just one things. How to allow some super-users (basically the staff), to access other apps ?
a konami code ?
iddqd
just a button that opens a dialog with PIN input, check it against prefs and GG
<@U0830HE7P> unfortunately, there is no keyboard
PIN are easier to forget that touch pattern, no ?
konami + pin
and dont be as dumb as Mcdo.
konami + pin + face recognition
dont put the pin to 0000
please.
is 1234 secure enough :wink:
4321 even more
or 0000 instead of 0000
oh wait...
shit.. that’t the code for my luggage
every 4-digit pin is not secure without limitation for incorrect tries. Turn on electric shock on 3rd wrong input
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a6iW-8xPw3k>
oh man ain’t seen that movie in ages :smile:
reverse it, 0000 is too easy. Put 0000.
better put 0000 in random order every day
<@U055GGAHS> oh awesome! Thank's :) . I don't have access to my pc this weekend. But I'll have a look at the behavior classes at Monday!
I didn't find the source with Google and in AS all I did was the ctrl left-click :D
Np
Some stores use the store number as pin which they continently enough print on their receipts ;)
That word there was something else :/
The only pin code I honestly don't care about is the pin I need to give in in order to order a movie via my cable kind of subscription
I don't know what it's called, but it gives you a lot of channels and pretty resolution
So when I kill my app (swipe it away in recents), old notifications re-appear (with some missing data), regardless of whether or not they were dismissed
Nevermind, the documentation lied to me
as is the norm
:stuck_out_tongue:
The docs say NotificationManager.notify(tag, id, note) will use the pair (tag, id) as the unique key for a notification
So I thought "All I have is a string, so let's just use that as the tag and pass 0 for the id"
Nope.
nope indeed :smile:
does anyone know how to achieve this effect - <http://www.materialup.com/posts/pull-down-animation-interface>
that would be a hard one to pull off
that gif would be inside the toolbar, but how do you get that wavy effect? in the bottom of the toolbar?
canvas
<@U055GGAHS>: lol yes, i agree, but if it had to be done, how would someone do it? :simple_smile:
that should all be possible with canvas.. the animation rowing would be the hardest part
the wavy lines is just a sine wave or similar
And then the dude looks like he is four or five images.
yeah you could do it that way too probably way easier
otherwise you need something SVG to canvas and a lot of time
Yeah
honestly though I wouldn’t do it
it looks neat but its one of those things you’ll spend a crap load of time on and for what reason
looks cool the first time then it just gets annoying (from user perspective)
that kind of stuff would be good for the app instructions though
Oh, we had one that was built for us a gotchosen, and we were like sure… give us a month
what if we get a gif with that animation?
or even frames
then how would you make it work on all devices
scaling would be problematic
Pray
hah
would it? the boat+rowing is one animation and the waves is another animation
not really
i know glide plays gifs pretty well if its not a 5mb gif :stuck_out_tongue: which it doesnt look like it is
the paddle is in front of the waves and the boat is behind
hmmm
ok even if it is one animation
why would you say its hard?
well doing it by hand is going to take a long time.. scaling a gif is not going to work right
its going to be blurry on pretty much everything except for what you target
I suppose you could put multiple scales of the gif in there at the cost of a lot of space being used
webp may be a better format given that
but what are you going to do for a tablet
that animation really only works on phones in portrait
even landscape on a phone.. that wont work
it’ll just be massive and annoying
sounds like an interesting challenge
that animation, to me, looks like something someone did in after effects and not on a real device
actually looking at the comments other people say the same thing
absolutely, its on after effects
the reason whyi asked is i;ve come across plenty of such animations
which im wondering how (if possible) to implement it
you mean animations on that site or crazy animations in apps
on that site
gotcha
i havent really seen crazy animations in apps
have you come across any
yeah that is for a good reason =P
trying to do that in canvas is going to not only be hard but expensive
it’ll be difficult to get decent performance on a lot of devices I would imagine
but I would like to see someone do it
if you have the free time, go for it
I definitely would not agree to take that on as work though so don’t do that =P
unless theres a huge bounty for it :stuck_out_tongue:
yeah sure
is there?
lol no
damn
would you have given a shot at it if it did?
if there was money yeah why not
ive done crazy stuff for resumes.. I built a 2d UI on top of a 3d surface as a resume app for google
but I couldn’t get past their insane interview so that wasn’t time well spent
well did you learn?
uhh I learned a lot reading books prepping for the interview
so time wasn’t wasted
if you didnt learn anything then i agree with you :stuck_out_tongue:
I spend most of my time doing new stuff so I just learned different new stuff compared to what I would have done otherwise
I wasn’t particularly happy with the process
that’s my real complaint
so going full circle if you find some crazy animation request for money let me know I would be happy to check it out
sure thign
*thing

<https://sites.google.com/a/android.com/tools/recent/androidstudio13releasecandidate4available|Android Studio 1.3 Release Candidate 4 Available>
Android Studio 1.3 RC 4 is now available in the canary channel. This build fixes the following issues:The LogCat window no longer switches to a different process when the current process dies (issue <http://b.android.com/161145|161145>)Prevent "StartupAbortedException" for the IDE when there are foreign/conflicting .jar files in the JDK extensions directory (issue <http://b.android.com/180551|180551>)Fix incorrect nullness information for Android SDK methods (requires...
